originalText.text:
Lorin is a very talented make up artist.  She made me look beautiful on my wedding day by highlighting my eyes and cheek bones  and minimizing a small facial scar.   I liked her work so much that i hired her for a work event where she gave make up lessons and did make up for our small team   Everyone loved this and were excited to show off their beautiful faces!
Lorin is creative, patient and understands clients' needs - try her!

originalText.text: I don’t like her Makeup And Hairstyles that much because she ruined my hairstyle and make up. And at the end she made me upset and cried. She doesn’t has any correct foundation with my skin tone and she do the make up and hairstyle in the restroom. She make my skin tone darker in the Photographing. I keep asking her to make my skin tone Brighter, and she made my skin tone darker. I paid for this $300 for the appointment. When I came to her appointment, she keeps telling me that like she have another appointment and she keeps getting frustrated with my make up and hairstyle and she told me that another Make Up Appointment people paid a lot. I had a traditional Lengha dress. I keep telling her to Help me with the dress, and she keeps telling me that I don’t have time to fix the dress. In my opinion, I think she need more Experience with the Makeup And Hairstyles and respect the people. All the time she was keep rushing with Makeup And Hairstyles. I wouldn’t use her service again. Then when I came in to her appointment then she even did not make a grace faced a smile. I don’t think any other  Professional Make Up Artist they gonna take the customer to the restroom to do the make up that an awkward weird.

originalText.text:
My left eyebrow was destroyed by this makeup "artist." I had beautiful, thick brows before my appointment here. Lorin insisted that my brows had "crazy hairs" and "needed repair," and ripped off half of my left eyebrow. The end result is a classic 90s overtweezed tadpole brow. When I sent her a photo of my tattered brows afterwards, she accused me of misrepresenting her work, when her mistake is clear as day.
She also did not have a foundation color matching my skintone. When I pointed this out to her, first she claimed my face is tan (lol no), then she told me that the color itself doesn't matter and I need to go to Sephora to find my color myself. Getting a personalized foundation match was one the very reasons I was paying for a $500 appointment.
The lesson was conducted in a small bathroom which had a vanity chair in it. Makeup palettes were stacked up on the floor, and as she worked, Lorin stowed makeup in the sink, which struck me as exceptionally unsanitary. I cannot find any record of her having a cosmetology license.
Also note that she also keeps cats in her apartment, which will present issues for anyone with allergies.

originalText.text: I was back in NYC after several years for an event. I again used Lorin to do my Makeup and again she surpassed herself. I looked fabulous and got so many compliments. I felt very listened to  as I explained what look I was going for. She also gave me some very good tips. Lorin I love the remodeled  bathroom space to do the makeup... It was cosy and elegant. Again it rally makes a difference to get your makeup done by an artist that has an eye for detail and beauty.

originalText.text: I was referred to Lorin by a well known photographer.  As an older woman, it was very important for me to photograph well.  I needed Lorin to help me with my makeup. I took an incredible class with Lorin  who has a wonderful eye for color, proportion and things I generally would miss.   It is nothing short of astonishing to watch yourself become pretty under her tutelage.  I love my new makeup and can’t say enough about this award winning makeup artist.
